template.description: An object of the aut-num class is a database representation of an Autonomous System (AS), which is a group of IP networks operated by one or more network operators that has a single and clearly defined external routing policy.

attributes.name: aut-num
attributes.description: The autonomous system number.
attributes.syntax:
An "AS" string followed by an integer in the range
from 0 to 4294967295

attributes.name: as-name
attributes.description: A descriptive name associated with an AS.
attributes.syntax:
Made up of letters, digits, the character underscore "_",
and the character hyphen "-"; the first character of a name
must be a letter, and the last character of a name must be a
letter or a digit.  The following words are reserved by
RPSL, and they can not be used as names:

 any as-any rs-any peeras and or not atomic from to at
 action accept announce except refine networks into inbound
 outbound

Names starting with certain prefixes are reserved for
certain object types.  Names starting with "as-" are
reserved for as set names.  Names starting with "rs-" are
reserved for route set names.  Names starting with "rtrs-"
are reserved for router set names. Names starting with
"fltr-" are reserved for filter set names. Names starting
with "prng-" are reserved for peering set names. Names
starting with "irt-" are reserved for irt names.

attributes.name: descr
attributes.description: A short decription related to the object.
attributes.syntax: A sequence of ASCII characters.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Specifies the status of AS number represented in the aut-num.
attributes.syntax:
Status can have one of these values:

o ASSIGNED
     This status is for ASNs issued to AFRINIC Resource members under the ASN
     assignment policy, AFPUB-2004-ASN-001, or its successors
o ASSIGNED-ANYCAST
     This status is for ASNs issued to AFRINIC Resource members under the
     Anycast Assignment Policy , AFPUB-2012-V4-001, or its successors
o POLICY-RESERVED
     This status is for ASNs issued under the policy AFPUB-2014-GEN-004, or
     its successors

attributes.name: member-of
attributes.description: This attribute can be used in the route, aut-num and inet-rtr classes. The value of the "member-of:" attribute identifies a set object that this object wants to be a member of. This claim, however, should be acknowledged by a respective "mbrs-by-ref:" attribute in the referenced object.
attributes.syntax:
An as-set name is made up of letters, digits, the
character underscore "_", and the character hyphen "-"; it
must start with "as-", and the last character of a name must
be a letter or a digit.

An as-set name can also be hierarchical.  A hierarchical set
name is a sequence of set names and AS numbers separated by
colons ":".  At least one component of such a name must be
an actual set name (i.e. start with "as-").  All the set
name components of a hierarchical as-name have to be as-set
names.

attributes.name: import
attributes.description: Specifies import policy expression.
attributes.syntax:
[protocol <protocol-1>] [into <protocol-1>]
from <peering-1> [action <action-1>]
    .
    .
    .
from <peering-N> [action <action-N>]
accept <filter>

attributes.name: mp-import
attributes.description: Specifies multiprotocol import policy expression.
attributes.syntax:
[protocol <protocol-1>] [into <protocol-1>]
afi <afi-list>
from <peering-1> [action <action-1>]
    .
    .
    .
from <peering-N> [action <action-N>]
accept (<filter>|<filter> except <importexpression>|
        <filter> refine <importexpression>)

attributes.name: export
attributes.description: Specifies an export policy expression.
attributes.syntax:
[protocol <protocol-1>] [into <protocol-1>]
to <peering-1> [action <action-1>]
    .
    .
    .
to <peering-N> [action <action-N>]
announce <filter>

attributes.name: mp-export
attributes.description: Specifies a multiprotocol export policy expression.
attributes.syntax:
[protocol <protocol-1>] [into <protocol-1>]
afi <afi-list>
to <peering-1> [action <action-1>]
    .
    .
    .
to <peering-N> [action <action-N>]
announce <filter>

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: Specifies default routing policies.
attributes.syntax: to <peering> [action <action>] [networks <filter>]

attributes.name: mp-default
attributes.description: Specifies default multiprotocol routing policies.
attributes.syntax: to <peering> [action <action>] [networks <filter>]

attributes.name: remarks
attributes.description: Contains remarks.
attributes.syntax: A sequence of ASCII characters.

attributes.name: org
attributes.description: Points to an existing organisation object representing the entity that holds the resource.
attributes.syntax:
The 'ORG-' string followed by 2 to 4 characters, followed by up to 5 digits
followed by a source specification.  The first digit must not be "0".
Source specification starts with "-" followed by source name up to
9-character length.

attributes.name: admin-c
attributes.description: References an on-site administrative contact.
attributes.syntax:
From 2 to 4 characters optionally followed by up to 5 digits
optionally followed by a source specification.  The first digit
must not be "0".  Source specification starts with "-" followed
by source name up to 9-character length.

attributes.name: tech-c
attributes.description: References a technical contact.
attributes.syntax:
From 2 to 4 characters optionally followed by up to 5 digits
optionally followed by a source specification.  The first digit
must not be "0".  Source specification starts with "-" followed
by source name up to 9-character length.

attributes.name: notify
attributes.description:
Specifies the e-mail address to which notifications of changes to an
object should be sent.
This attribute is filtered from the default whois output.
attributes.syntax: An e-mail address as defined in RFC 2822.

attributes.name: mnt-irt
attributes.description: May appear in an inetnum, inet6num or aut-num object. It points to an irt object representing a Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT) that handles security incidents for the address space specified by the object.
attributes.syntax:
An irt name is made up of letters, digits, the character
underscore "_", and the character hyphen "-"; it must start
with "irt-", and the last character of a name must be a
letter or a digit.

attributes.name: mnt-lower
attributes.description: Specifies the identifier of a registered mntner object used for hierarchical authorisation. Protects creation of objects directly (one level) below in the hierarchy of an object type. The authentication method of this maintainer object will then be used upon creation of any object directly below the object that contains the "mnt-lower:" attribute.
attributes.syntax:
Made up of letters, digits, the character underscore "_",
and the character hyphen "-"; the first character of a name
must be a letter, and the last character of a name must be a
letter or a digit.  The following words are reserved by
RPSL, and they can not be used as names:

 any as-any rs-any peeras and or not atomic from to at
 action accept announce except refine networks into inbound
 outbound

Names starting with certain prefixes are reserved for
certain object types.  Names starting with "as-" are
reserved for as set names.  Names starting with "rs-" are
reserved for route set names.  Names starting with "rtrs-"
are reserved for router set names. Names starting with
"fltr-" are reserved for filter set names. Names starting
with "prng-" are reserved for peering set names. Names
starting with "irt-" are reserved for irt names.

attributes.name: mnt-routes
attributes.description:
This attribute references a maintainer object which is used in
determining authorisation for the creation of route6 objects.
This entry is for the mnt-routes attribute of aut-num class.
After the reference to the maintainer, an optional list of
prefix ranges inside of curly braces or the keyword "ANY" may
follow. The default, when no additional set items are
specified, is "ANY" or all more specifics.
attributes.syntax: <mnt-name> [ { list of (<ipv4-address>/<prefix> or <ipv6-address>/<prefix>) } | ANY ]

attributes.name: mnt-by
attributes.description: Specifies the identifier of a registered mntner object used for authorisation of operations performed with the object that contains this attribute.
attributes.syntax:
Made up of letters, digits, the character underscore "_",
and the character hyphen "-"; the first character of a name
must be a letter, and the last character of a name must be a
letter or a digit.  The following words are reserved by
RPSL, and they can not be used as names:

 any as-any rs-any peeras and or not atomic from to at
 action accept announce except refine networks into inbound
 outbound

Names starting with certain prefixes are reserved for
certain object types.  Names starting with "as-" are
reserved for as set names.  Names starting with "rs-" are
reserved for route set names.  Names starting with "rtrs-"
are reserved for router set names. Names starting with
"fltr-" are reserved for filter set names. Names starting
with "prng-" are reserved for peering set names. Names
starting with "irt-" are reserved for irt names.

attributes.name: changed
attributes.description: Specifies who submitted the update, and when the object was updated. This attribute is filtered from the default whois output.
attributes.syntax:
An e-mail address as defined in RFC 2822, followed by a date
in the format YYYYMMDD.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: Specifies the registry where the object is registered. Should be "AFRINIC" for the AFRINIC Database.
attributes.syntax:
Made up of letters, digits, the character underscore "_",
and the character hyphen "-"; the first character of a
registry name must be a letter, and the last character of a
registry name must be a letter or a digit.
